page.title: 19Historic Buildings
page.content: {ST. MARY'S CHURCH} An original saxon building which dates from 1240. Interesting features are stalls from Thame abbey,14th century screen and the tomb of lord William. {THE PREBENDAl} Built in about 1234 this was the residence of the bishop's officals when they viseted Thame. {THE TITHE BARN} The barn is a half timbererd brick building. Tithes were the people's contribution to the clergy. {THE TOWN HALL} The present brick building was built in 1887 to commemorate the jubilee of Queen Victoria. {THE SPREAD EAGLE} This is a fine 18th century brick building mentioned in "Brideshead Revisited" and made famous by John Fothegill(its owner in the 1920's.
